intro: Galium pseudoellipticum, commonly known as narrowleaf bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release minute seeds when mature. Galium pseudoellipticum typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
